content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are moderately cautious and may take risks but generally prefer to avoid them. You like to have some degree of security and predictability. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 42$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 42$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 12$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

Given my preference for security and predictability, I would opt for the strategy that ensures a more consistent payoff over time. In this case, choosing 'B' would yield me a payout of $12 per round on average when my anonymous partner also chooses 'B'. If they consistently pick 'R', I could potentially earn more in individual rounds (up to $45), but the unpredictability and potential for earning zero is high. As a result, I would choose B{B}.
You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 42$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.

Since my objective is to maximize my average earnings over the long term, I should stick with the strategy that was profitable in the previous round (my opponent chose 'R' while I chose 'B', earning me $42). So, in this next round, I will again choose B{B}.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 12$. Your opponent's payoff is 12$. Please play the next round.
